intro: Senecio commutatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are linear and often have a bluish or grayish hue, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio commutatus is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
